alert.note: Alert for Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 10:28AM CDT until November 01 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Yellow River at Necedah affecting Juneau County. .Heavy rain from earlier in the week will result in rises along the Yellow River at Necedah. The river is forecast to possibly reach Moderate flood stage early next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Necedah. * WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 16.5 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 05/21/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM CDT.
